newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish bank PBK privatisation seen delayed.
newsitem.headline: Polish bank PBK privatisation seen delayed.

text.p: The decision on an investor for Poland's Powszechny Bank Kredytowy SA (PBK) will not be taken by June 12 as earlier reported, a deputy treasury minister said on Wednesday.
The state treasury is offering up to 65 percent of PBK shares, preferably a majority stake, to a strategic investor or a group of investors.

"The decision won't be taken on June 12," Piotr Czyzewski told a news conference. He added that, in the next few weeks, the government would study the outcome of talks between potential investors and the treasury ministry.
Neither the ministry nor its adviser, HSBC Investment Services, would say how many investors had made final bids for PBK.
So far a consortium of Polish Development Bank (PBR), Bank Przemyslowo- Handlowy (BPH), Kredyt Bank and insurer Warta has confirmed it was bidding for at least 51 percent of PBK.

Last week, the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) said it was willing to invest up to 15 percent of PBK. Banking sources have said South Korea's Samsung was also interested in buying stakes in PBK, but it did not confirm the reports.
